dcterms:creator: E. Bertin
dcterms:description: Sky Maker is a software tool used to simulate astronomical images, allowing for the evaluation of image quality under various conditions, including complex backgrounds and point spread functions.
dcterms:title: Sky Maker

dcterms:creator: E. Bertin
dcterms:description: Stuff is a software tool that generates catalogs of celestial objects for use in astronomical simulations, providing a basis for testing image quality evaluation algorithms.
dcterms:title: Stuff

dcterms:creator: J. Wei
B. Cordier
S. Antier
dcterms:description: GWAC (Ground Wide Angle Camera Array) is a telescope array designed for automatic observation of time-domain astronomical events, providing data that can be affected by complex backgrounds and exposure failures.
dcterms:title: GWAC (Ground Wide Angle Camera Array)

dcterms:creator: H.-L. Li
J. Wang
L.-P. Xin
dcterms:description: Gaia DR3 is the third data release from the Gaia mission, providing extensive astrometric and photometric data for a large number of celestial objects, which can be used for magnitude calibration in photometry.
dcterms:title: Gaia DR3
